meanings.definition: Over the side of a ship or boat.
meanings.sent1: The sailor fell overboard during the storm.
meanings.sent2: The crew threw the old equipment overboard to make space.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull swooped down and snatched a fish overboard.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight danced on the waves overboard, creating a magical scene.
meanings.sent5: The salty spray from the ocean overboard soaked the deck of the ship.

meanings.definition: To go to extremes or act recklessly.
meanings.sent1: He tends to go overboard with his jokes, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: Don't go overboard with your spending; stick to your budget.
meanings.sent3: The chef went overboard with the spices, making the dish inedible.
meanings.sent4: She went overboard in her praise, making her friend blush.
meanings.sent5: The fans went overboard with their support, cheering loudly for their team.
